intro: Ternstroemia minoriflora, commonly known as the small-flowered ternstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
